New Records: Harry Wilson became the first Welshman to score in three successive games for Wales since Gareth Bale at Euro 2016.
Key Match Events: Harry Wilson converted a penalty to give Wales the lead after being fouled by Vladimir Jovovic.
Montenegro had a chance to equalize with a long-range shot by Andrija Radulovic that hit the crossbar.
Pre-Game Insights: Wales were unbeaten under new manager Craig Bellamy after four matches.
The match was significant as it was the first meeting between Wales and Montenegro since their 0-0 draw in Cardiff last month.
Post-Match Reflections: Wales controlled the game and Nathan Broadhead missed a late chance to double their lead.
Top spot in the group will be on the line when Wales travels to Turkey on Nov. 16.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Cardiff City Stadium in front of 27,326 fans.
The game was refereed by Filip Glova.
